executive_summary: Tom Hayes is bullish on the market, citing the Santa Claus rally and expectations of a supportive Fed. He anticipates a rotation out of the MAG 7 into the unmagnificent 493, favoring defensives, healthcare, and energy. He highlights several stocks with significant upside potential, emphasizing long-term plays and dividend payers. He also discusses potential risks, including a hawkish Fed chair and the impact of AI on certain sectors.

key_reasons: Santa Claus rally typically occurs from December 15th to 30th.
Expectations of a supportive Fed with Kevin Hasset as a dove.
Tax loss selling season is in the rear view mirror.

macro_thesis_summary: Hayes believes that the market will rally into the end of the year and continue into 2026, driven by a supportive Fed and fiscal stimulus. He anticipates a rotation out of the MAG 7 into other sectors, particularly defensives, healthcare, and energy. He expects volatility in 2026 but overall positive returns.

key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: Mimics Morgan Stanley, Deutsche Bank, Goldman Sachs. It's on the basis of a supportive Fed.

key_macro_data_points.indicator: Midterm Election Years Average S&P Return
key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: Defensives and healthcare outperform in those periods, the unmagnificent 493.
They are always early and they are always right. Expect slightly higher energy prices in 2026.
I would take the under on fund strat this year. I'd say 5 to 7% on the indices. If you own outside the mag seven, uh you could make a lot more there.

BA.thesis_summary: Boeing is a national champion and proxy for US manufacturing operating in a growing duopoly, backed by a $636 billion backlog. Kelly Ortberg is a true home run hire and key catalyst in the Boeing turnaround.
key_metrics: Positive free cash flow of $238 million in the last quarter.
Commercial airplane deliveries reached 160 for the quarter, up 38% year-on-year.
Commercial backlog now stands at $535 billion and includes more than 5,900 airplanes.
BA.price_target_or_valuation: Greater than $10 billion of annual free cash flow target.

EL.thesis_summary: Estee Lauder is experiencing a turnaround with improving revenue, profitability, and market share gains, particularly in China. The company is focused on higher growth, higher margin digital channels and is executing a profit recovery and growth plan.
key_metrics: Adjusted EPS of 32 cents beat expectations by 14 cents.

new_or_recent_additions: New healthcare sector position (triple 3-4 bagger potential)
risks_and_contrarian_flags: Potential for a hawkish Fed chair (Wars) leading to a 15% correction in 2026.
AI wiping out certain sectors (e.g., Dualingo).
Overweighting S&P index or MAG 7 leading to lower returns on invested capital.
